title: NASA agreements to support work on commercial spacecraft and space stations
summary: NASA partnerships announced June 15 would support development of new commercial capabilities that include a Blue Origin crewed spacecraft and a Starship-derived space station from SpaceX.

title: CesiumAstro to develop satcom terminal for U.S. Air Force drone
summary: CesiumAstro won a U.S. Air Force contract to develop a phased array antenna for military drones.

title: Rocket Report: China addresses falling rocket debris, Vulcan launch slipping
summary: FAA is "taking a finer pencil to the way operations are run and managed."

title: Technical problem postpones final Ariane 5 launch
summary: Arianespace has postponed the final launch of the Ariane 5, potentially for several weeks, after discovering a potential problem with pyrotechnical systems on the rocket.

title: Eutelsat reversing course with European retail broadband business sale
summary: Eutelsat told the Paris stock exchange June 15 it is selling its European retail broadband activities to “an experienced private operator” to return focus to wholesale services.

title: BREAKING! NASA Partners With SpaceX, Blue Origin, Sierra Space + 4 Others For Future Commercial Space Capabilities
summary: In a significant move to foster innovation and advance the future of human spaceflight and the U.S. commercial low Earth orbit economy, NASA has announced the second Collaborations for Commercial Space Capabilities-2 initiative (CCSC-2) and is partners with with seven American companies.

title: Seven US Companies Collaborate with NASA to Advance Space Capabilities
summary: NASA will partner with seven U.S. companies to meet future business and government needs, ultimately benefitting human spaceflight and the U.S. commercial low Earth orbit economy.

title: Virgin Galactic sets late June date for first commercial SpaceShipTwo flight
summary: Virgin Galactic announced June 15 that it plans to conduct the first commercial flight of its SpaceShipTwo suborbital vehicle in late June on a mission for the Italian Air Force.

title: Virgin Galactic sets first commercial space tourism flight for this month; shares spike more than 40%
summary: Virgin Galactic aims to launch its commercial space tourism service in late June.

title: ISS finishes initial iROSA upgrade with two EVAs this month
summary:
The International Space Station’s iROSA (ISS Roll-Out Solar Array) solar panel upgrade, started in 2021, has finished its initial upgrade plan with the successful installation of the last two arrays this month. The arrays for the 1A and 1B power channels were brought to ISS aboard the CRS-28 Cargo Dragon flight and then installed in a pair of EVAs by NASA astronauts Steve Bowen and Woody Hoburg.

The iROSA project was started due to the ongoing degradation of the Station’s existing solar panels after years in low-Earth orbit. The original solar array complement, finished in March 2009 with the installation of the S6 truss, was capable of 240 kilowatts when new. However, the radiation environment in orbit has degraded the arrays to the point where they can now only generate 160 kilowatts.
